featured.text: Why couldn’t the researchers get the answer to their research questions? (A) Many cattle in their study were sitting on the ground.
The researchers were therefore unable to answer their research questions of whether cattle prefer to look north or south, and whether that differs in the northern and southern hemispheres.
Dogs bark before earthquakes; cattle predict rainfall by sitting on the ground.
The researchers concluded that cattle do generally orient themselves in a north-south direction.

other.text: Whether cattle behave like compass needles.
But cattle may have another hidden talent in telling which way is north.
The cattle constantly change directions to avoid wind chill.

The researchers therefore had to study a lot of cows grazing in lots of different places at different times of day, in order to average out these factors and see whether cattle could act like compass needles.
What is the major finding of Dr. Begall’s study? (A) Cattle point north-south.
Whether cattle are superior to other animals.

definition.zh_def: 牛類，特指用於農業或肉類生產的家畜。
definition.en_def: Domesticated bovine animals raised for milk, meat, or labor.
definition.example: The farmer has a large herd of cattle grazing in the field.
